prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning.  Here is the text: One night two young men from Egulac went down to the river to hunt seals and while they were there it became foggy and calm. Then they heard war-cries, and they thought: 'Maybe this is a war-party'. They escaped to the shore, and hid behind a log. Now canoes came up, and they heard the noise of paddles, and saw one canoe coming up to them. There were five men in the canoe, and they said: 'What do you think? We wish to take you along. We are going up the river to make war on the people.' One of the young men said,'I have no arrows.' 'Arrows are in the canoe,' they said. 'I will not go along. I might be killed. My relatives do not know where I have gone. But you,' he said, turning to the other, 'may go with them.' So one of the young men went, but the other returned home. And the warriors went on up the river to a town on the other side of Kalama. The people came down to the water and they began to fight, and many were killed. But presently the young man heard one of the warriors say, 'Quick, let us go home: that Indian has been hit.' Now he thought: 'Oh, they are ghosts.' He did not feel sick, but they said he had been shot. So the canoes went back to Egulac and the young man went ashore to his house and made a fire. And he told everybody and said: 'Behold I accompanied the ghosts, and we went to fight. Many of our fellows were killed, and many of those who attacked us were killed. They said I was hit, and I did not feel sick.' He told it all, and then he became quiet. When the sun rose he fell down. Something black came out of his mouth. His face became contorted. The people jumped up and cried.He was dead.

stories: ##TEXT## One night, two young men from Egulac went to the river to hunt seals, and as they were there, a fog crept in, making everything calm and quiet. Suddenly, they heard war cries, and they thought it might be a war party. They escaped to the shore and hid behind a log. Meanwhile, a canoe containing five men approached, and they requested the young men to join them in their mission to make war on the people upstream. However, one of the young men declined, opting to return to Egulac, while the other chose to join the warriors. As they reached a town on the other side of Kalama, a battle ensued, causing many casualties. Later, one of the warriors exclaimed, 'Quick, let's go home; that Indian has been hit.' In retrospect, the young man who stayed behind thought the warriors were ghosts. Despite this, he accompanied them to the location and joined the fight. Many of their fellow warriors were killed, and many from the opposing side were also fallen. The warriors claimed the young man had been hit, but he denied feeling any pain. When the sun rose, he mysteriously succumbed to death, and a black substance emerged from his mouth. His face contorted, and the people mourned his passing.##TEXTEND## What would you like to do next?The text has been rephrased without changing its meaning. ##TEXT## Two friends from Egulac ventured to the river at night, seeking to hunt seals. As they hunted, a fog rolled in, bringing an eerie calm to the area. Suddenly, they were startled by war cries and believed they had stumbled upon a rival war party. They hastily retreated to the shore and hid behind a log. Meanwhile, a canoe carrying five men drew near, extending an invitation for the friends to join their mission to wage war against the upstream population. One of the friends declined, opting to return to Egulac, while the other chose to join the warriors. As they approached a town on the other side of Kalama, a fierce battle ensued, resulting in many casualties. Later, one of the warriors exclaimed, "Hurry, let's leave; that native has been wounded." In hindsight, the friend who remained behind believed the warriors were spirits. Despite this, he accompanied them to the location and joined the fight. Many of their comrades were felled, and many from the opposing side met their demise as well. The warriors claimed the young man had been hit, but he denied feeling any pain. When the sun rose, he surprisingly succumbed to death, and a black substance emerged from his mouth. His face contorted, and the people mourned his passing. ##TEXTEND##.
